We make a unique and memorable dining experience Food Menu Drink Menu VIP BOTTLE SERVICE about cavo CAVO caters to a diverse group of patrons and event guests alike. As the Florida sun takes its nightly slumber, CAVO transforms from an elegant dinner and serene lounge setting morphing to an after dark atmosphere. Arrive early to dine either inside or outdoors and stay late to delight in the after dark scene of Naples‚Äô hottest destination. V. I. P.  Table CAll Us! FAQ ‚Äî Cavo Home RESERVATIONS Menu Dress Code Contact Us Welcome Events Home RESERVATIONS Menu Dress Code Contact Us Welcome Events Thank you for contacting Cavo Nightclub! We are open every Friday and Saturday from 9:00pm -2:00am. Reservations are not necessary to come down but we do recommend getting there early before 10:30pm.¬† We have no cover on Fridays and a $5 cover on Saturdays, starting at 10:00pm. We also offer VIP table service, see details below on how to reserve your table. Please be advised that we book up fast and sometimes weeks in advance so please do not delay in making your reservation. Here's how VIP service at Cavo works. You must meet the minimum bottle requirement purchase for each table. We have tables located all around the nightclub and they have different minimums. The tables around the DJ booth on the dance floor are the most desired and have higher minimums. Depending on availability, group size and date of party, the bottle minimums for the Dj tables are between 2-4 bottles.¬† We also have tables located in our lounge area, mezzanine, and Latin room, these tables require a 1-2 bottle minimum.¬† A 7% liquor tax and 20% gratuity is added to every tab.¬† Please click the link below for our bottle menu and pricing. Message us back if you would like to move forward with a reservation. Click Here ‚Äî> Cavo Bottle Menu & Pricing Frequently Asked Questions‚Ä¶ How old do you have to be to enter? Every guest must be 21 years of age or older and must have proper identification. No exceptions. How many guests can I have at my VIP table? All of our VIP areas are different sizes. Most of them can accommodate groups of 10-15 people and can (seat) 6-8. We do have a few larger areas that can accommodate larger parties, please specify your party size when making the reservation. What does my ViP reservation include? Your reservation includes your Vip table area for the evening, the bottles of your choice with mixers, with the exception of Redbull, there is an up charge.¬† It also puts you and your guests, up to 15 people on the guest list so you will not pay a cover. How and when do I place my bottle order for my table? Deposits are not necessary at the time of booking. Once you arrive and are seated in your section, the server will take your bottle order, ID, and payment. We accept all major credit cards and cash. What type of music do you play? We normally have 2 DJs, two rooms. We have a Latin Dj in the front room both Friday and Saturdays.¬† In the back dance floor area we play an open format which is a little bit of everything but mostly high energy dance music. What time should I arrive if I have a VIP reservation? You can arrive anytime between 9:00pm and 11:30pm.¬† If you arrive after 11:30pm we cannot guarantee your VIP area. What is your Dress code? Cavo is a fun place for a night out dancing we expect our guests to dress for the occasion.¬† Absolutely NO Ball Caps, (Dress hats are the only acceptable headwear). No Sweatpants, No Jerseys, No Hoodies. No large backpacks or large bags. Most importantly: No bad Attitudes. How does your Limo shuttle service work? The limo works like this, the limo holds 12 people, we prefer to pick up groups of 8-12 people but we can make the occasional exception. Your group must all be in one location within the vicinity of Pittsburgh. It‚Äôs only a one-way ride to the club, you will be responsible for your own ride home. The limo is stocked and completely complimentary but we do recommend that you throw a small tip to the driver. If you would like to book a limo pick up please send us your phone number, location and preferred time of pick up and we will confirm depending on availability. Do you do anything for Birthdays? Yes, if you have a VIP table reservation we will bring out our happy birthday sign and have the Dj give you a shout out over the mic.¬† The servers get extremely busy and will bring out the sign sometime after midnight when they are able to. If you would like to request this please let us know when you make the reservation. Back To Top CAVO ‚Ä¢ 1916 Smallman St ‚Ä¢ Strip District ‚Ä¢ Pittsburgh ‚Ä¢ 412 929-0471

In the Know: Cavo finally set to launch in Mercato Home Subscribe Manage Login Logout News Sports Business Entertainment Opinion Lifestyles Community Weather Traffic Jobs Homes Cars Classifieds Weekly Ads Today's Paper In the Know: Cavo finally set to launch in Mercato

Nearly two years in the making, Cavo Lounge in finally set to launch Monday, Aug. 31, in Mercato in North Naples. Photo by Tim Aten

Tim Aten In The Know Posted: Aug. 12, 2015 0 Comments SHARE Nearly two years in the making, Cavo Lounge in finally set to launch Monday, Aug. 31, in Mercato in North Naples. Photo by Tim Aten Nearly two years in the making, Cavo Lounge in finally set to launch Monday, Aug. 31, in Mercato in North Naples. Photo by Tim Aten Posted: Aug. 12, 2015 0 Q: As a concierge here in Naples, I follow your column faithfully. Thank you for your diligent work! We drove by Cavo at Mercato, and it looks very close to being ready. Do you know anything as far as when the doors might open? We have eagerly been anticipating this one! Keep up the great work! ‚Äî Margaret Cruz, North Naples A: Nearly two years in the making, Cavo Lounge in Mercato is almost ready for its big reveal at the end of this month. Monday, Aug. 31, is the launch date for the long-awaited nightspot. ‚ÄúWe like to label it as an eclectic, upscale gastro lounge. It‚Äôs going to be a very cool, fun environment,‚Äù said Rocky Patel, co-owner of the new business in the popular North Naples development. The opening of Cavo will complete its Strada Place block, made up entirely of eateries and bars. This entertainment section in the heart of Mercato stretches from Taps Restaurant, Bar & Lounge to Bravo! Cucina Italiana, and from Second Cup to McCormick & Schmick‚Äôs. In between are The Counter Burger and Rusty Bucket Restaurant & Tavern, with Cavo forming a trio of lounges with its neighboring Blue Martini and familial Burn by Rocky Patel. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost like we have our own little Bourbon Street going on in Mercato,‚Äù said Jason Buro, Cavo‚Äôs general manager who relocated to Naples last year from New York. ‚ÄúI think this is going to be the new hot spot between Burn, Blue Martini and Cavo. It should become the entertainment trifecta,‚Äù Patel said. At 6,580 square feet under air, Cavo will be the third largest dining spot in Mercato, surpassed in size only by McCormick & Schmick‚Äôs (8,455 square feet) and Bravo (6,929 square feet). Cavo‚Äôs prominent patio area brings its square footage closer to 8,500, which was no easy feat to amass. Cavo‚Äôs space was cobbled from some undeveloped space in the large center island it shares with only Taps, as a few other smaller retail shops were redeveloped. To make way for the new lounge, Bio women‚Äôs clothing store moved across the street and Swim ‚Äòn Sport apparel shop closed. Cavo was originally targeted to launch in early 2014, but the project faced setbacks, Patel said. ‚ÄúIt was, unfortunately, some of the general contractors that caused undue delays on our end,‚Äù he said. Cavo is designed to be worth the wait. The lounge has tables and booths inside, as well as outdoor seating that wraps around its exterior. ‚ÄúThe main beauty of the place is a big area with an indoor-outdoor bar,‚Äù Patel said. The overall look of the lounge, which features scores of seats at the bar, is designed to be eclectic and inviting. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very conversational and very welcoming,‚Äù Patel said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve used a lot of different wood finishes. The bar has recycled antique wood with a pewter top.‚Äù Patel describes Cavo‚Äôs d√©cor as a cool mixture of rustic Old World with exotic, modern accents. Cavo blends wood and pewter finishes, breaking up its wooden floor and ceiling with metal bar stools and light fixtures. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a real beautiful mix of soft and hard natural elements,‚Äù Buro said. It‚Äôs no coincidence that Cavo will have a New York taste and feel. Patel co-owns the new lounge with Steve Tallides and Lawrence Cerullo, who are part of S Hospitality Group, which owns S Prime steakhouse and Studio Square beer garden on Long Island, as well as Cavo, an upscale restaurant in Astoria, New York. Although they share a name, Cavo in Naples will bear no resemblance to its New York counterpart, Patel said. The local Cavo, however, will feature New York-style food and chefs with a diverse menu of fun small plates from regions around the world. ‚ÄúThe menu here is a very eclectic, international, small plate menu,‚Äù Buro said. Selections include a world tour: Korean chicken lollipops, Greek salad with saginaki, garlicky shrimp and grits, maple-glazed bacon satay, pork belly with pickled Napa cabbage, and cavatelli with wild mushrooms and mascarpone cream sauce. There also will be a charcuterie board, marinated skirt steak, lamb chops, grilled octopus and spicy tuna tartare. While the menu includes the obligatory flatbreads, its sliders offer twists with bratwurst, crab cake and short rib choices. Likewise, mini gyros are offered with pork, beef or chicken. The Cavo grilled cheese is upgraded with Fontina cheese, applewood smoked bacon and Granny Smith apples on brioche toast. Cavo is designed to be a relaxing restaurant that will seamlessly morph into a late-night lounge after 10 p.m. with an upbeat atmosphere. The lounge has specialized cocktails, including Margaritas and sangria on tap, Patel said. ‚ÄúIt will be very much like a New York lounge, more like South Beach,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a very interesting place that Mercato has never seen.‚Äù Cavo‚Äôs drink specialties include cocktails such as the Bluebini, made with Stoli Blueberi vodka, Prosecco and blueberries; White Raspberry Truffle, which combines Ciroc Red Berry vodka with Godiva White Chocolate Liqueur and Chambord; and Poco Picante, which includes Don Julio Silver tequila, Grand Marnier, agave nectar, melon cubes and jalape√±o wheels. Although Patel also owns the Burn cigar lounge next door, he said Cavo will operate as a separate entity with its own identity. In addition to its public operation, Cavo will be amenable to hosting private parties such as weddings or charity events, Patel said. For the latest in local restaurants coming and going, see ‚ÄúIn the Know‚Äù archived columns at naplesnews.com/intheknow , and on Facebook at facebook.com/timaten.intheknow . Have a local question? Email it with your name and city of residence to intheknow@naplesnews.com . About Tim Aten Tim Aten, a Naples Daily News journalist since 1998, has written the newspaper‚Äôs popular ‚ÄúIn the Know‚Äù column for more than 10 years. He previously was news editor and chief online editor for the Daily News. Before relocating to Naples, Tim was a managing editor of newspapers in the Florida Keys for 6 years. He and his wife of 25 years located to Florida in 1992 from Northeast Ohio, where he began his journalism career 30 years ago. The club has been the brainchild of its owner named Nikos Daktylides. He has the vision of creating a clubbing venue that was far from the busy party town of Mykonos. Thus, by taking advantage of the natural beauty of the mesmerizing sea, the owner came up with the innovative idea of designing this heavenly place in Mykonos. The club is known for its amazing look of the Aegean Sea ahead and boasts spectacular bars across two levels of the club. To top it all, the club also consists of a separate terrace area that offers breathtaking views of the sea ahead. There is also a unique pool at its terrace that has been shaped as the town of Mykonos . If you are looking for some top-class clubbing experience ‚Äìaway from the hustle of the city, then Cavo Paradiso nightclub in Mykonos is a perfect destination for you. Cavo Paradiso Club Mykonos Information Address The Cavo Paradiso nightclub is located at Paradise Bay in Mykonos. Entry Fee The entry fee for the exclusive Cavo Paradiso nightclub in Mykonos is around 25 Euros. However, the club reserves its right to allow or disallow entry to anyone and the prices might also vary at times. Therefore, it is recommended that you must book tables in advance. Reach out to us now! Guestlist The Cavo Paradiso nightclub boasts the presence of high-end A-listers, VIPs, socialites, and leading celebrities from all over the world. If you also wish to be a part of its impressive guest list, then you can reach out to us now. We are available on WhatsApp and call services. Cavo Paradiso Mykonos Table Bookings The Cavo Paradiso nightclub allows for exclusive table bookings in advance. You can do so by filling out the online booking form. Our excellent 24/7 concierge services is also available to help you out. You can also give us a call or contact us on WhatsApp for receiving your custom quote for VIP table reservations. Dress code There is no specific dress code to the Cavo Paradiso nightclub. However, you must not be inappropriately dressed in swimsuits or sportswear to enter one of the best nightclubs in Mykonos . Email info@chalounge.com Cha Lounge Leeds Cha Lounge Leeds Cha Lounge Leeds Cha Lounge Leeds 1/6 Cha Lounge is an independent caf√© bar in the heart of Leeds Be Curious... ‚Äã The choice: to focus our energy on obstacles or opportunities. The Cha Lounge seeks to cultivate what‚Äôs right for the world. Through promoting a truly ethical and environmentally friendly ethos, we endeavour to provide for you incredibly healthy, great-tasting foods and beverages in a relaxing atmosphere. All our suppliers are from sustainable, fair trade communities...and our food suppliers are all British, with foods being locally sourced from the most ethical farmers...we never compromise on quality and health. We can serve you uniquely blended fresh juices, carefully thought out with scientific knowledge in order to maximise nutritional value. Our coffee and teas are second to none. Our beers and organic wines are matched well with our global small plates. We supply meats from local farms and sustainable fish. We are also vegan and celiac friendly. We use freshly baked bread from a local bakery. ‚Äã We have the largest range of ethical leaf teas and unique blends in Leeds. We reinvest into the tea plantations through Eteaket. We use North Star coffee beans as they reinvest into farmers and are also fairtrade and locally roasted. Indulge in our unique champagne afternoon tea...a fashionable treat that everyone can enjoy, made with healthy, fresh delicious produce and changing menus each month. ‚Äã Our aim is to cultivate a feeling of well-being and escapism while contributing to a fairer society. ‚Äã We operate as sustainably as possible and use 100% renewable energy and have a zero waste policy ‚Äã Community and social justice is at the heart of what we do; 10% of profits go to charities. ‚Äã Quality, integrity and sustainability. We'd love to see you soon. ‚Äã The Cha Lounge team. About Us | CAVO Email: gen@cavo.org.uk Phone: 01570 423232 Home Get Involved Volunteering Organisations Individuals Engagement & Influence Get Help Volunteering Funding Good Governance About Us Contact Staff & Trustees Room Hire Connect Connect Ceredigion Funding Wales Volunteering Wales Infoengine About Us CAVO promotes, supports and empowers voluntary community action in Ceredigion. Since 1997, the CAVO Team have promoted and supported volunteers and voluntary community action in Ceredigion ‚Äì from finding volunteers their perfect role to giving grants for community projects, the CAVO Team are here to help. As Ceredigion‚Äôs County Voluntary Council and a Third Sector Support Wales partner, CAVO work across the following four key pillars of activity in supporting the third sector and volunteers, and in our work with key statutory partners; Volunteering Good Governance Sustainable Funding Engagement and Influence We can support you to develop your group and projects and help you recruit new volunteers.¬† We‚Äôll also keep you informed of what‚Äôs happening in Ceredigion and beyond! Support us by sharing your successes and challenges so we can best represent the sector and champion what you‚Äôre achieving. Our work Our Cynnig Cymraeg Welsh Offer If you call us or write to us in Welsh, we will deal with your enquiry in Welsh. If the staff member does not speak Welsh, they offer to transfer the call to a Welsh speaker when possible You can read all our marketing material for projects in Welsh as it is produced bilingually You can look at our website and contact us on social media in Welsh as our website is bilingual and our content on social media is posted bilingually You are welcome to contribute in Welsh at our events, we will deliver our activities in ways that encourage the use of Welsh language We are very proud that we have a number of staff, volunteers and trustees with Welsh language skills and we encourage staff, volunteers and trustees to show the public who speaks Welsh with Iaith Gwaith resources. Contact us to have a chat or book an appointment for a face to face visit.
